thread.title: Milwaukee Admirals assign Joe Pendenza to Cincinnati Cyclones
thread.title_full: Milwaukee Admirals assign Joe Pendenza to Cincinnati Cyclones

author: Justin Soderberg
title: Milwaukee Admirals assign Joe Pendenza to Cincinnati Cyclones
text:
Tweet on Twitter Joe Pendenza joins Cincinnati Cyclones. (Photo/Scott Paulus) 
The Milwaukee Admirals , AHL affiliate of the NHL’s Nashville Predators , have announced they have re-assigned forward Joe Pendenza to the ECHL’s Cincinnati Cyclones . 
Pendenza has skated in two of the three Admirals’ games this season, but has yet to find his way onto the scoresheet. The former UMass Lowell River Hawk is now in his third season as a part of the Predators’ organization. 
The Wilmington, Massachusetts native is no stranger to the Cyclones. He spent 13 games in the ECHL last season, tallying seven points (3g, 4a) with 14 penalty minutes. 
Last season with the Admirals, Pendenza tallied 18 points (9g, 9a) over 48 games. 
Prior to turning pro, Pendenza spent four years at UMass Lowell from 2010-2014. The forward tallied 110 points (49g, 61a) over 152 games while leading the River Hawks to a the team’s first regular season title and back-to-back Hockey East tournament titles. Pendenza led all River Hawks in goals (14) assists (16), and points (30) during his senior year. 
Pendenza is one of two former River Hawks currently under contract in the Predators organization. Carter Hutton is the backup goaltender at the NHL level. The forward re-signed with the Admirals this past offseason . 
Follow Joe Pendenza and other former River Hawks with our Hockey Alumni Hub .
